_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

The starting point of skillful qualities: Live restrained in the monastic code
Seeing danger in the slightest fault, keep the rules youâ€™ve undertaken
The four kinds of mindfulness meditation: Meditate observing an aspect of the body
Meditate observing an aspect of feelings
Meditate observing an aspect of mind
Meditate observing an aspect of principles
The realization of the mendicant [sn47.4: He lived alone, withdrawn, diligent, keen, and resolute
He developed the four kinds of mindfulness meditation
He expected growth in skillful qualities
He realized the supreme end of the spiritual path in this very life
He achieved with his own insight the goal for which gentlemen rightly go forth from the lay life to homelessness
He understood that rebirth is ended, the spiritual journey has been completed, what had to be done has been done, and there is no return to any state of existence.
